comments.body: does this test really examine `isIdentifierText`? from what I can see it's only used to validate `compilerOptions.reactNamespace` and used for printing symbol names in `getNameOfSymbolAsWritten -> getNameOfSymbolFromNameType`. Other uses are in services for several completions.

`·Äí` wasn't going to parse correctly without this change, since it's lower 8 bits aren't a valid character on it's own. `·Å°` wasn't really needed in hindsight, since `ùëÄ` already covers the case when the last 8 bits are a valid character.
